name: Lion
description: The lion is the second largest member of the cat family after the tiger. Lions live in parts of Africa and India. Their loud roar is among the most terrifying sounds of the grasslands. The scientific name of the lion is Panthera leo.

name: Horse
description: The horse is a mammal that people have valued for thousands of years. In the past people commonly used horses to get from place to place and to pull heavy loads. The scientific name of the horse is Equus caballus.

name: Fox
description: Foxes are mammals that look like small, bushy-tailed dogs. They live all over the world. Different kinds favor different habitats.

name: Koala
description: The koala bear is an Australian tree-dwelling marsupial mammal that has large hairy ears, thick gray fur, sharp claws for climbing, and no tail and feeds on eucalyptus leaves. They sleep for up to 19 hours a day.

name: Badgers
description: Badgers are mammals known for their powerful digging. They are related to weasels, skunks, otters, and mink. Badgers live in many habitats, including grasslands and forests.

name: Giraffe
description: The giraffe is the tallest living animal. It can reach a height of more than 18 feet (5.5 meters). Giraffes have a short body, but their legs and neck are very long. Giraffes live on the plains of eastern Africa.

name: Bison
description: Bison are the largest land mammals in North America and Europe. The animal commonly called the American buffalo is actually the American bison. The European bison is also called the wisent.

name: Bear
description: Bears are large, powerful mammals related to dogs and raccoons. There are several species, or types, of bear. They are the polar bear, the brown bear, the black bear, the Asiatic black bear, the sun bear, the spectacled bear, and the sloth bear.

name: Wolf
description: Wolves are members of the dog family. They are known for their intelligence and courage. Wolves are also noted for traveling very long distances. North American Indians named their most powerful warriors after wolves

name: Tiger
description: The tiger is the largest of the cats. Like lions, tigers are very strong and fierce hunters. Tigers are found in the wild only in parts of Russia, China, and South and Southeast Asia. They live in forests, grasslands, and swamps.

name: Owl
description: Owls are birds of prey, meaning that they hunt and eat animals. Unlike most other birds of prey, owls are nocturnal, or active at night. Their nighttime activity, quiet flight, and strange calls have made them the subject of many stories.

name: Eagle
description: Eagles are large birds of prey, meaning that they hunt and eat animals for food. They are related to hawks, falcons, and vultures. Eagles have long held a special place in the human imagination because of their strength and soaring flight.

name: Crocodile
description: Crocodiles are lizardlike, flesh-eating animals. They are the largest living members of the group of animals called reptiles. They are related to alligators.

name: Frog
description: Frogs are small animals that can jump very well. Frogs are similar to toads. However, a frog has smooth skin and long legs. A toad has rough skin and shorter legs. Frogs are found throughout the world except in very cold places.

name: Shark
description: Sharks are fast-swimming fishes that have a skeleton made of cartilage instead of bone. (Cartilage is an elastic tissue that is created before bone begins to form.) They are related to rays. Sharks are among the oldest animals on Earth.

name: Whale
description: Whales are large animals that live in water. Whales may look like fishes, but they are mammals. They breathe air and produce milk for their young. Whales make up an order, or large group of animals, called Cetacea.

name: Dolphin
description: Dolphins look like big fishes, but they are actually mammals. They belong to a large group of animals called whales. Dolphins are closely related to porpoises. However, dolphins are usually larger and have longer, beaklike snouts.

name: Salmon
description: Salmon are fish that are known for making long, difficult journeys in order to breed. Salmon belong to the scientific family Salmonidae, which also includes trout.

name: Orca
description: Killer whales, also called orcas, are mighty hunters of the ocean. They earned the name “killer” because they eat other whales.

name: Wyvern
description: A wyvern is a legendary bipedal winged dragon usually depicted with a tail ending in a diamond- or arrow-shaped tip.

name: Phoenix
description: The phoenix is a legendary bird born out of fire. It was said to have red and gold feathers and a beautiful voice.. For many ancient peoples, this fabulous bird represented death and rebirth.

name: Pegasus
description: Pegasus was a winged horse in ancient Greek mythology. According to legend, he was created when the hero Perseus cut off the head of a frightful monster. Pegasus sprang from the monster’s blood.

name: Megalodon
description: Megalodon was a kind of shark that lived millions of years ago. It is now extinct. It is thought to be the largest shark, as well as the largest fish, that ever lived. The word megalodon means “giant tooth.”

name: Tyrannosaurus Rex ( T-Rex )
description: Tyrannosaurus rex, or T. rex, was one of the largest and most ferocious predators ever to walk on Earth. The name Tyrannosaurus rex means “king of the tyrant lizards.” T. rex was just one of the group of dinosaurs called tyrannosaurs.

name: Pterodactyl
description: Pterodactyls were flying reptiles of prehistoric times. They lived about 145 to 65.5 million years ago, at the same time as the dinosaurs. Remains of pterodactyls have been found all over the world.

name: Penguin
description: Penguins are the only birds that can swim but cannot fly. These black and white seabirds move about very easily in the water. On land they stand upright and waddle about.

name: Ptilopsis
description: The northern white-faced owl (Ptilopsis leucotis) is a species of owl in the family Strigidae. The southern white-faced owl (P. granti) was formerly included in this species and the two were known as the white-faced scops-owl.

name: Nightingale
description: The nightingale is a small, plain-looking bird with a big voice. Many people think its highly varied, musical songs are beautiful. Sometimes people call other birds with musical songs nightingales.

name: Elephant
description: Elephants are the largest living land animals. There are three species, or kinds: the African savanna elephant, the African forest elephant, and the Asian elephant. They make up the elephant family of mammals.
